page.title: 04THE CLAPPERS (CONTINUED)
page.content: As part of a national exercise to examine the viability and accuracy of the boundaries of some Sites of Special Scientific Interest, those of the Clappers are currently being reviewed. Situated at the foot of the Clappers, on the Harlington Road, are three dwellings and a public house which has recently changed hands. In June 1983 the Free House was bought by a Mr.Solomon, who changed the name from "The Flying Horseshoes" to "The Lynmore". The name is an amalgam of his wife and daughter's first names - Lynn and Maureen. Some extensive alterations have been made to the two bars by knocking down a dividing wall between them and outer building at the back of the house which in the past, may have been used as stabling. Original beams have been exposed and
